Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Pitcher
Description: Narrow-mouthed pitcher with pouring spout, short and narrow neck, curved walls and foot with small ring-shaped collar. There is a suspension loop, quadrangular in cross-section, which starts at the neck and ends at the shoulder. The surface has a reddish coating and a painted decoration consisting of vegetal motifs between parallel longitudinal lines. The handle also shows a painted decoration of irregular parallel bands.
